item.title: Delhi Elections 2025 Date Announcement Live: Delhi To Vote On February 5, Counting On February 8 - NDTV
item.description:
Delhi Elections 2025 Date Announcement Live: Delhi To Vote On February 5, Counting On February 8

Publication Date: October 2023  |  Source: NDTV

The assembly elections in Delhi will occur in a single phase on February 5, with votes counted on February 8, as announced by the Election Commission.

  • Election scheduled for February 5, 2025.
  • Counting of votes set for February 8, 2025.
  • The current 70-member Assembly's term ends on February 23, requiring elections to form a new House.
  • AAP aims for a third consecutive term, facing competition from BJP and Congress.
  • India to reach one billion voters soon, setting a new record.
“We are going to be a nation of one billion voters very soon, which will be another record in voting,” said Chief Election Commissioner Rajiv Kumar.

This announcement sets the stage for the upcoming electoral battle, highlighting the contest among major political parties and the increasing voter population in India.

item.title: GATE 2025 Admit Card Live Updates: Website to download GATE hall ticket - The Indian Express
item.description:
GATE 2025 Admit Card Live Updates: GATE hall ticket out; steps to download

Date: 2025-01-01 Source: The Indian Express

The Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Roorkee has released the GATE 2025 admit cards on the official website, gate2025.iitr.ac.in. Candidates can download their admit cards and verify all printed information.

  • The GATE 2025 exams will take place between February 1 and 16.
  • Candidates may appear for one or two test papers from a total of 30 available.
  • Exams will be conducted in forenoon (9.30 am to 12.30 pm) and afternoon (2.30 pm to 5.30 pm) sessions.
“If candidates find any discrepancies in the admit card, they should immediately contact the GATE administering body.”

This year, GATE is essential for admission to master’s and doctoral programmes as well as recruitment by some public sector undertakings.

item.title: Delhi Assembly poll schedule LIVE updates: Election Commission to announce dates shortly - The Hindu
item.description:
Delhi Assembly Elections 2025 LIVE: Voting on February 5, counting on February 8

Date & Source: January 07, 2025 - The Hindu

The announcement for the Delhi Assembly elections has been made, with voting scheduled for February 5, 2025, and counting of votes set for February 8, 2025.

  • Single-phase elections will be conducted in Delhi.
  • The Delhi Chief Election Commissioner emphasized a crackdown on the use of money power during elections.
  • Easy access and provisions for senior citizens and persons with disabilities will be ensured.
“India has a gold standard of elections, it’s a shared legacy for all of us including all political parties,” - CEC Rajiv Kumar.

This election is poised to influence the political landscape of Delhi significantly, highlighting key issues such as electoral integrity and participation rights.

item.title: 'Bahane nahi badlav chahiye': After AAP, BJP releases campaign song ahead of Delhi elections - The Times of India
item.description:
'Bahane nahi badlav chahiye': After AAP, BJP releases campaign song ahead of Delhi elections

Publication Date: October 2023 - Source: Times of India

The BJP has launched a campaign song titled 'Bahane nahi badlav chahiye', aggressively positioning itself ahead of the upcoming Delhi elections. This move follows a similar tactic by the AAP, showcasing the competitive political landscape.

  • The song emphasizes the need for change rather than making excuses.
  • BJP's strategy is to resonate with voters seeking tangible results.
  • Focus on addressing local issues that matter to Delhi residents.
“We want to push for real change, not just empty promises,” a BJP spokesperson stated.

This release marks a significant moment in the lead-up to the elections, indicating the BJP's commitment to addressing voter concerns and enhancing its appeal in Delhi.

item.title: Prashant Kishor hospitalised, says his fast unto death ‘will continue’ - The Hindu
item.description:
Prashant Kishor hospitalised, says his fast unto death ‘will continue’

Published on: January 07, 2025 01:37 pm IST
Source: The Hindu

Jan Suraaj Party founder Prashant Kishor was hospitalised suffering from dehydration after being previously arrested for a fast unto death protesting the Bihar Public Service Commission exams.

  • Kishor was found to be suffering from dehydration and infection.
  • He was taken to a healthcare facility in Patna after medical advice.
  • Despite his condition, he declared that his fast unto death would continue.
  • He began the hunger strike on January 2 and was arrested on January 6.
  • The fast is part of a protest against alleged irregularities in the BPSC exams.
"My fast unto death will continue" - Prashant Kishor

The situation surrounding Prashant Kishor illustrates the ongoing protests regarding the BPSC exams and significant public engagement in the issue.

item.title: Where Is Atul Subhash's Son? Nikita Singhania's Lawyer Replies In Top Court - NDTV
item.description:
Court's 'Stranger' Remark As Atul Subhash's Mother Seeks Grandson's Custody

Publication Date: Recent, Source: Not specified

In a custody battle concerning AI techie Atul Subhash's four-year-old son, his estranged wife, Nikita Singhania, revealed to the Supreme Court that the child is currently in a boarding school in Faridabad, Haryana. Following Atul's tragic suicide in December, his mother Anju Devi is seeking custody.

  • Atul Subhash took his own life after accusing Nikita of harassment.
  • Nikita's family is facing abetment to suicide charges.
  • The Supreme Court directed that the child be produced in the next hearing.
  • Concerns raised about the child's unfamiliarity with his grandmother.
  • The custody issue is to be decided in the appropriate court.
“Sorry to say but the child is a stranger to the petitioner,” remarked Justice Nagaratna.

The next hearing is scheduled for January 20.

item.title: Delhi Election Live Updates: Arvind Kejriwal launches campaign song for assembly polls - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi Election Live Updates: Election Commission to announce Delhi polls schedule shortly

Publication Date: Recent updates from the Election Commission.

The Election Commission of India is set to announce the schedule for the General Election for the Legislative Assembly of Delhi. This announcement comes amidst a political row regarding the voter roll.

  • The Election Commission's press briefing is scheduled for 2:00 PM.
  • The term of the 70-member Assembly ends on February 23.
  • The final electoral roll shows over 1.55 crore registered voters in Delhi.
  • First-time voters aged 18-19 have increased by 52,554 since the last electoral roll.
  • AAP’s campaign song was released, highlighting achievements in governance.
  • Allegations of voter list manipulations raised by both AAP and BJP.
"We celebrate our elections like festivals, and people wait for our song; now it's out, and people can dance to it." - Arvind Kejriwal

The upcoming elections in Delhi are generating significant interest, with preparations underway from all political parties.

item.title: Godman Asaram Bapu bail: SC grants interim bail in 2013 rape case on medical grounds till March 31 - The Hindu
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Supreme Court Grants Interim Bail To Asaram Bapu In Rape Case For Medical Treatment - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Grants Interim Bail To Asaram Bapu In Rape Case For Medical Treatment

Publication Date: January 7
Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court has granted interim bail to self-styled godman Asaram Bapu, who is serving a life sentence in a rape case, allowing him to seek medical treatment until March 31, 2025.

  • The bail was granted by Justices M.M. Sundresh and Rajesh Bindal, with a condition that Asaram must not meet his followers while released.
  • Asaram's legal team argued his health condition justified the need for bail, citing his advanced age and history of heart problems.
  • The Solicitor General opposed the bail, stating Asaram has adequate medical care in jail.
  • The bail was issued on humanitarian grounds, with the court allowing for a reassessment of Asaram's medical status closer to the end of the bail period.
  • The original conviction involved multiple charges of rape and other serious offenses against a female disciple.
“The relief was granted solely on humanitarian grounds.”

This decision allows Asaram to undergo necessary medical treatment while under specific conditions imposed by the court.

item.title: Rape Convict Asaram Bapu Gets Interim Bail, But Can't Meet His Followers - NDTV
item.description:
Asaram Granted Interim Bail by Supreme Court Despite Rape Convictions

Date: Recent news from Source: NDTV

A week after self-styled godman Asaram returned to jail from a previous parole, the Supreme Court has granted him interim bail on medical grounds in a 2013 rape case. However, he will remain incarcerated as he seeks bail in another case.

  • Asaram, 83, was convicted for raping a teenager in his Jodhpur ashram in 2013.
  • He has been sentenced to life imprisonment for the crime.
  • The court granted bail until March 31, with restrictions on meeting followers.
  • Police are instructed to escort him only for medical treatment.
  • Asaram's lawyers cited serious medical ailments in their request for bail.
Asaram is suffering from serious medical ailments.

The court's decision reflects ongoing legal proceedings amid his multiple convictions.

item.title: Mystery of the Indus script: Over 100 failed deciphering attempts, the ‘Sanskrit link’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
Mystery of the Indus script: Over 100 failed deciphering attempts, the ‘Sanskrit link’

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: The Indian Express

Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M K Stalin has announced a $1 million prize for deciphering the script of the Indus Valley Civilization, an enigma that has stumped scholars for over a century.

The Indus script remains a mystery with more than 100 documented failed attempts at decipherment. Recent studies have identified potential connections between the script and South Indian graffiti.

  • M K Stalin announced a $1 million prize for successful deciphering.
  • Over 100 attempts to decipher the Indus script have been made without success.
  • Research identifies parallels between Indus Valley graffiti and Tamil Nadu markings.
  • Debate exists regarding links between the Indus script and Sanskrit.
  • Recent hypotheses question whether the Indus script is a true writing system.
“The script was not used for religious purposes, nor did it phonetically spell out words to encode names of ancient deities.” - Bahata Ansumali Mukhopadhyay

The search for understanding the Indus script not only continues to intrigue scholars but also holds significance in uncovering the social and commercial dynamics of the ancient civilization.

item.title: Budget 2025: Raise income tax exempt limit to Rs 10 lakh - RSS Unions tell FM Sitharaman - The Times of India
item.description:
RSS Unions Urge FM Sitharaman to Raise Income Tax Exempt Limit to Rs 10 Lakh in Budget 2025

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

The RSS unions have called on Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman to increase the income tax exemption limit to Rs 10 lakh in the upcoming Budget 2025, emphasizing the need for financial relief for middle-class taxpayers.

  • The current income tax exemption limit is lower, causing financial strain on families.
  • RSS unions argue that raising the limit will stimulate consumer spending.
  • Increased exemption is viewed as a necessary step towards economic recovery.
"A revision of the exemption limit will enhance disposable income and spur economic activity," said a union representative.

This request reflects the growing concerns of the middle class regarding rising living costs and the desire for more favorable tax provisions.

item.title: 'Naxalites are rattled': CM Vishnu Sai lifts coffins of jawan killed in Chhattisgarh IED blast - The Times of India
item.description:
Naxalites are rattled: CM Vishnu Sai lifts coffins of jawan killed in Chhattisgarh IED blast

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

The article discusses a recent incident in Chhattisgarh where CM Vishnu Sai honored the jawans who lost their lives in an IED blast attributed to Naxal militants. It highlights the ongoing conflict in the region and the government's commitment to countering such threats.

  • The incident took place in Chhattisgarh, a region affected by Naxalite violence.
  • CM Vishnu Sai attended the funerals, demonstrating respect and support for the families of the deceased jawans.
  • Local authorities are under pressure to improve security measures in light of the attack.
“We will not bow down to Naxal threats. Their activities will not deter our will to protect our state.” - CM Vishnu Sai

This tragic event underscores the continuing conflict in Chhattisgarh and the sacrifices made by security forces in the fight against insurgency.

item.title: Buses from Uppal to Cherlapalli railway terminus soon; nearest metro station 11 km away - The Hindu
item.description:
Direct Bus Services from Uppal to Cherlapalli Railway Terminal to Begin Soon

Published: January 07, 2025 12:02 pm IST | Source: The Hindu

The inauguration of Cherlapalli Railway Terminal on January 6, 2025, enhances public transport accessibility for passengers, with new bus services from Uppal expected soon.

  • Buses currently operate from Secunderabad and Mehdipatnam to Cherlapalli.
  • Direct services from Uppal will connect to Platform 9.
  • Nearest Metro station, Habsiguda, is 11 km away.
  • Cab fares to the terminal range from ₹160 to ₹520 depending on distance and location.
  • Plans for MMTS services starting from or passing through Cherlapalli are being discussed.
"Cherlapalli Railway Terminal enhances public transport connectivity for Hyderabad's growing transit needs." - Transport Official

This development aims to improve connectivity to the newly inaugurated rail terminal, easing travel for many commuters.

item.title: HMPV cases live: Centre, health experts appeal for calm after five test positive - Hindustan Times
item.description:
HMPV cases live: Odisha begins testing at several places following Centre advisory

Date: January 6, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The article discusses the initiation of testing for Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) in Odisha following guidance from the Centre after isolated cases were reported. It emphasizes the health measures being undertaken across various states.

  • Five cases of HMPV reported across India.
  • Odisha has started testing at several locations.
  • Symptoms include mild cold-like signs, with serious risks for young children and immunocompromised individuals.
  • No significant outbreak reported, and health officials urge calm.
“There is no need to panic,” said Gujarat Health Minister Rushikesh Patel.

In conclusion, while HMPV cases are being monitored, officials stress preparedness and public awareness over alarm.

item.title: Telangana High Court refuses to quash FIR against BRS MLA KT Rama Rao in Formula E Race case - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Telangana High Court Upholds FIR Against BRS MLA KT Rama Rao in Formula E Race Funding Case

Published on: 07 Jan 2025, 6:22 am

The Telangana High Court has refused to quash an FIR against BRS MLA K.T. Rama Rao related to allegations of corruption in the Formula E race funding case. The ruling comes amid claims of political vendetta and serious charges against Rao.

  • Justice K Lakshman dismissed the plea to quash the FIR.
  • The FIR involves charges of criminal breach of trust and violations of the Prevention of Corruption Act.
  • The allegations stem from irregularities in funding for the Formula E race, which was cancelled after the Congress took power.
  • Rao's counsel argued the case is politically motivated.
  • The State's Advocate General noted serious allegations against Rao, including alleged misappropriation of funds.
“Rao cannot be prosecuted simply on account of a policy decision taken in 2023.” - KTR's Senior Advocate C Aryama Sundaram

The court's decision reinforces serious scrutiny over the financial dealings associated with significant events in Telangana.

item.title: Assam mine: Three feared dead as India deploys divers, helicopters to rescue trapped miners - CNN
item.description:
Three Feared Dead as India Deploys Divers, Helicopters to Rescue Trapped Miners

Date: January 7, 2025 Source: CNN

Three miners are feared dead inside a flooded coal mine in Assam, India, as rescue teams work overnight to reach nine men trapped inside the mine.

  • Rescue teams reported spotting three bodies but have not yet recovered them.
  • The army has deployed divers, helicopters, and engineers for rescue operations.
  • The incident occurred due to flooding in the mine, likely caused by hitting a water channel.
  • Coal mining disasters are common in northeastern India, with past incidents resulting in significant casualties.
“The mine got flooded yesterday — the source was internal. They probably hit some water channel and water came out and flooded it,” Mayank Kumar, district police chief in Dima Hasao.

The rescue operation is ongoing, with efforts focused on reaching the nine trapped miners and recovering the bodies.

item.title: GATE 2025 Admit Card Released on gate2025.iitr.ac.in, Direct Link - Times Now
item.description:
GATE 2025 Admit Card Released on gate2025.iitr.ac.in, Direct Link

Publication Date: Today. Source: Times Now

The Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE) admit card has been released today, serving as a crucial document for candidates.

  • Essential for admission to postgraduate programs in IITs and IISc.
  • Must carry the admit card and a valid photo ID to the exam center.
  • GATE scores are also used by PSUs for recruitment.
  • Conducted jointly by IITs and IISc.

GATE 2025 Hall Ticket: Here's how to download admit card

  1. Visit the official website - gate2025.iitr.ac.in
  2. Access the GOAPS portal and log in.
  3. Enter enrollment ID and password.
  4. Download the admit card.

The GATE exam will occur on February 1, 2, 15, and 16, 2025.

item.title: HMPV cases live: Centre advises states to strengthen awareness measures - Hindustan Times
item.description:
HMPV cases live: Centre advises states to strengthen awareness measures

Publication Date: January 6, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Health authorities are advising states to increase public awareness and preparedness as five cases of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) infections have been reported in India. The Centre emphasizes that these infections are manageable and not a cause for panic.

  • Five cases of HMPV reported in India, with no widespread outbreak.
  • Children under 3 and immunocompromised individuals advised to take precautions.
  • Health systems are being prepared to manage potential surges in cases.
  • Public health guidelines are being issued to strengthen awareness.
  • Health experts state that HMPV has been circulating globally since its identification in 2001.
“There is no need to panic. The government is ready for any situation.” - Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Brajesh Pathak

In conclusion, while cases of HMPV have been identified, health experts reassure the public that it is not a new virus, and normal precautions should suffice to prevent serious illness.

item.title: Supreme Court To Hear West Bengal Govt's Plea Against Cancellations Of OBC Classifications On January 28... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court To Hear West Bengal Govt's Plea Against Cancellations Of OBC Classifications On January 28

Date: January 28, 2024

Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court has scheduled a hearing for the West Bengal government's petition challenging the Calcutta High Court's decision to quash the OBC classification of 77 communities. The hearing is set for January 28 and 29.

  • The Calcutta High Court annulled the OBC status of 77 communities.
  • Justice BR Gavai and Justice Augustine George Masih will preside over the case.
  • The Solicitor General indicated the National Commission for Backward Classes has submitted relevant documents.
  • Concerns were raised about proper consultation and process transparency regarding OBC classifications.
  • The High Court's order reflected on potential political motivations behind the classifications.
“The Commission and State acted in undue haste... no proper enquiry was conducted by the Commission.”

The Supreme Court's ruling will determine the future of OBC classifications in West Bengal, potentially impacting the communities involved.

item.title: Three feared dead as India deploys divers, helicopters to rescue trapped miners - CNN
item.description:
Three feared dead as India deploys divers, helicopters to rescue trapped miners

Publication Date: Not specified   |   Source: CNN

Three miners are feared dead inside a flooded coal mine in Assam, India, while rescue teams are desperately trying to reach the trapped individuals.

  • Three bodies have been spotted but not yet recovered.
  • A total of nine men have been trapped since Monday in the mine.
  • Rescue operations involve army teams deploying divers and helicopters.
  • The mine flooded due to an internal water channel that was likely hit by the miners.
  • Previous coal mine disasters in northeastern India highlight ongoing safety concerns.
“The mine got flooded yesterday — the source was internal. They (the miners) probably hit some water channel and water came out and flooded it,” - Mayank Kumar, district police chief in Dima Hasao.

Efforts continue as local authorities and rescue teams strive to recover those trapped and prevent further loss of life.
